p: (7) The historical study of plague epidemics, for instance, the complete history of the Black Death (1346â€“1353) or the epidemics of the Second Plague Pandemic (1346-c. 1690), shows that they consistently display the characteristic patterns of seasonality and spread of rat-and-rat-flea-borne plague of Y. pestis [ 12, 28, 54]. This is in complete concordance with the standard works on plague and also the historical views provided by diachronic historical comparison by the authors [ 11, 26, 41].
